 020:                                      np.ndarray[np.float32_t, ndim=1] arr_sig,
 021:                                      np.float32_t dist_max=0.0, np.float32_t dist_padding=0.0,
 022:                                      np.uint8_t regulate_paddings=1):
 023:     '''Compares the R-peaks of two arrays that are moved by time_delta.
 024:     arr_ref (np.array): Reference array with timestamps assumed to be correct
 025:     arr_sig (np.array): Array that is not synchroneous
 026:     dist_max (None, float): Maximal accepted distances, default None: 1/4 of the median gap of arr_ref
 027:     dist_padding (None, float): Assumed distances of non-overlapping (padding) matches, default None: 1/4 of the median gap of arr_ref
 028:     regulate_paddings (bool): regulate non-overlapping events in arr_sig with a maximum distance of err_max
 029:     '''
+030:     cdef np.uint32_t i1 = 0, i2 = 0, counter = 0
  __pyx_v_i1 = 0;
  __pyx_v_i2 = 0;
  __pyx_v_counter = 0;

 092: # def sparse_search_time_delta(arr_1, arr_2, td_min, td_max, sparse_factor=1, pps=100,
 093: #                              dist_max=None, regulate_paddings=True, dist_padding=None):
 094: #     '''Compares the arrays for a range of time_deltas in a given interval.
 095: #     arr_ref (np.array): Reference array with timestamps assumed to be correct
 096: #     arr_sig (np.array): Array that is not synchroneous
 097: #     td_min (float): lower bound of the search space for the time shift of arr_ref
 098: #     td_max (float): upper bound of the search space for the time shift of arr_ref
 099: #     sparse_factor (int): factor for the sparseness of arr_sig for the calculation (default 1)
 100: #     pps (int): number of investigated time-shifts per second, should be higher than 10 times the number of median gap of arr_ref (default 100).
 101: #     dist_max (None, float): Maximal accepted distances, default None: 1/4 of the median gap of arr_ref
 102: #     dist_padding (None, float): Assumed distances of non-overlapping (padding) matches, default None: 1/4 of the median gap of arr_ref
 103: #     regulate_paddings (bool): regulate non-overlapping events in arr_sig with a maximum distance of err_max
 104: #     '''
 105: #     # set the default values if unset
 106: #     # set dist_max and dist_padding relative to the median gap of the timestamps in the reference array if not set
 107: #     # TODO improve default value: min(np.median(np.diff(arr_sig)), np.median(np.diff(arr_ref))) / 4
 108: #     if dist_max == 0.0:
 109: #         dist_max = min(np.median(np.diff(arr_ref))/4, np.median(np.diff(arr_sig))/4)
 110: #     if dist_padding == 0.0:
 111: #         dist_padding = min(np.median(np.diff(arr_ref))/4, np.median(np.diff(arr_sig))/4)
 112: 
 113: #     np_nearest = np.zeros((int((td_max-td_min)*pps), 2), dtype=np.float32)
 114: #     np_nearest[:, 0] = np.arange(td_min, td_max, 1/pps)
 115: 
 116: #     # Random subsample
 117: #     if sparse_factor > 1:
 118: #         probe = arr_2.copy()[sparse_factor//2::sparse_factor]
 119: #     else:
 120: #         probe = arr_2.copy()
 121: #     # probe = arr_2
 122: #     for idx in range(np_nearest.shape[0]):
 123: #         # calculate the nearest advocate criteria of both arrays
 124: #         np_nearest[idx,1] = nearest_advocate(
 125: #             arr_1, 
 126: #             probe-np_nearest[idx,0],  # Arr 2 is shifted by time-delta
 127: #             dist_max=dist_max, regulate_paddings=regulate_paddings, dist_padding=dist_padding)
 128: #     return np_nearest
